def sort( self, by: Union[Hashable, Sequence[Hashable]], ascending: Union[bool, Sequence[bool]] = True) -> Self: 
691    def sort(
692        self,
693        by: Hashable | Sequence[Hashable],
694        ascending: bool | Sequence[bool] = True,
695    ) -> Self:
696        """
697        Sort the EventArray by column(s) in the info, metadata, or features DataFrames.
698        :param by: name of the column(s) to sort by.
699        :param ascending: whether to sort in ascending order; can be a list to match by
700        :return: a new, sorted EventArray.
701        """
702        order = self.get_sort_order(by, ascending)
703        info = self.info.loc[order].reset_index(drop=True)
704        if self.metadata is not None:
705            metadata = self.metadata.loc[order].reset_index(drop=True)
706        else:
707            metadata = None
708        if self.features is not None:
709            features = self.features.loc[order].reset_index(drop=True)
710        else:
711            features = None
712        return EventArray(info, metadata, features)

def get( self, column_names: Union[Hashable, Sequence[Hashable]]) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
714    def get(self, column_names: Hashable | Sequence[Hashable]) -> pd.DataFrame:
715        """
716        Get a DataFrame with the specified columns from the EventArray, by value.
717        :param column_names: the names of the columns to get.
718        :return: a DataFrame with the specified columns.
719        """
720        if isinstance(column_names, Hashable):
721            column_names = [column_names]  # Drop into a list for the loop
722        columns = []
723        for column_name in column_names:
724            if column_name in self.info.columns:
725                columns.append(self.info[column_name])
726            elif self.metadata is not None and column_name in self.metadata.columns:
727                columns.append(self.metadata[column_name])
728            elif self.features is not None and column_name in self.features.columns:
729                columns.append(self.features[column_name])
730            else:
731                raise ValueError(f"Column {column_name} not found in EventArray")
732        return pd.concat(columns, axis=1)

@classmethod
def merge(cls, events: Iterable[Self]) -> Self: 
800    @classmethod
801    def merge(cls, events: Iterable[Self]) -> Self:
802        """
803        Combine EventArrays in a list into a single EventArray.
804        :param events: the new list of events.
805        """
806        all_info = []
807        all_metadata = []
808        all_features = []
809        for event_array in events:
810            # Skip empty EventArrays
811            if event_array.info is not None:
812                all_info.append(event_array.info)
813            if event_array.metadata is not None:
814                all_metadata.append(event_array.metadata)
815            if event_array.features is not None:
816                all_features.append(event_array.features)
817        if len(all_info) == 0:
818            return EventArray()
819        else:
820            all_info = pd.concat(all_info, ignore_index=True)
821        if len(all_metadata) == 0:
822            all_metadata = None
823        else:
824            all_metadata = pd.concat(all_metadata, ignore_index=True)
825        if len(all_features) == 0:
826            all_features = None
827        else:
828            all_features = pd.concat(all_features, ignore_index=True)
829
830        return EventArray(all_info, all_metadata, all_features)

def to_events( self, scans: Union[csi_images.csi_scans.Scan, Iterable[csi_images.csi_scans.Scan]], ignore_missing_scans=True, ignore_metadata=False, ignore_features=False) -> list[Event]: 
832    def to_events(
833        self,
834        scans: Scan | Iterable[Scan],
835        ignore_missing_scans=True,
836        ignore_metadata=False,
837        ignore_features=False,
838    ) -> list[Event]:
839        """
840        Get the events in the EventArray as a list of events.
841        :param scans: the scans that the events belong to, auto-matched by slide_id.
842        Pass None if you don't care about scan metadata (pass ignore_missing_scans).
843        :param ignore_missing_scans: whether to create blank scans for events without scans.
844        :param ignore_metadata: whether to ignore metadata or not
845        :param ignore_features: whether to ignore features or not
846        :return:
847        """
848        if isinstance(scans, Scan):
849            scans = [scans]
850        scans = {scan.slide_id: scan for scan in scans}
851        events = []
852        for i in range(len(self.info)):
853            # Determine the associated scan
854            slide_id = self.info["slide_id"][i]
855            if slide_id not in scans:
856                if ignore_missing_scans:
857                    # Create a placeholder scan if the scan is missing
858                    scan = Scan.make_placeholder(
859                        slide_id,
860                        self.info["tile"][i],
861                        self.info["roi"][i],
862                    )
863                else:
864                    raise ValueError(
865                        f"Scan {self.info['slide_id'][i]} not found for event {i}."
866                    )
867            else:
868                scan = scans[slide_id]
869
870            # Prepare the metadata and features
871            if ignore_metadata or self.metadata is None:
872                metadata = None
873            else:
874                # This Series creation method is less efficient,
875                # but required for preserving dtypes
876                metadata = pd.Series(
877                    {col: self.metadata.loc[i, col] for col in self.metadata.columns},
878                    dtype=object,
879                )
880            if ignore_features or self.features is None:
881                features = None
882            else:
883                features = pd.Series(
884                    {col: self.features.loc[i, col] for col in self.features.columns},
885                    dtype=object,
886                )
887            # Create the event and append it to the list
888            events.append(
889                Event(
890                    scan,
891                    Tile(scan, self.info["tile"][i], self.info["roi"][i]),
892                    self.info["x"][i],
893                    self.info["y"][i],
894                    metadata=metadata,
895                    features=features,
896                )
897            )
898        return events

@classmethod
def from_events(cls, events: Iterable[Event]) -> Self: 
900    @classmethod
901    def from_events(cls, events: Iterable[Event]) -> Self:
902        """
903        Set the events in the EventArray to a new list of events.
904        :param events: the new list of events.
905        """
906        info = pd.DataFrame(
907            {
908                "slide_id": [event.scan.slide_id for event in events],
909                "tile": [event.tile.n for event in events],
910                "roi": [event.tile.n_roi for event in events],
911                "x": [event.x for event in events],
912                "y": [event.y for event in events],
913            }
914        )
915        metadata_list = [event.metadata for event in events]
916        # Iterate through and ensure that all metadata is the same shape
917        for metadata in metadata_list:
918            if type(metadata) != type(metadata_list[0]):
919                raise ValueError("All metadata must be the same type.")
920            if metadata is not None and metadata.shape != metadata_list[0].shape:
921                raise ValueError("All metadata must be the same shape.")
922        if metadata_list[0] is None:
923            metadata = None
924        else:
925            metadata = pd.DataFrame(metadata_list)
926        features_list = [event.features for event in events]
927        # Iterate through and ensure that all features are the same shape
928        for features in features_list:
929            if type(features) != type(features_list[0]):
930                raise ValueError("All features must be the same type.")
931            if features is not None and features.shape != features_list[0].shape:
932                raise ValueError("All features must be the same shape.")
933        if features_list[0] is None:
934            features = None
935        else:
936            features = pd.DataFrame(features_list)
937        return EventArray(info=info, metadata=metadata, features=features)

def to_dataframe(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
939    def to_dataframe(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
940        """
941        Convert all the data in the EventArray to a single DataFrame.
942        :return: a DataFrame with all the data in the EventArray.
943        """
944        # Make a copy of the info DataFrame and prepend "info_" to the column names
945        output = self.info.copy()
946        # Combine with the metadata and prepend "metadata_" to the column names
947        if self.metadata is not None:
948            metadata = self.metadata.copy()
949            metadata.columns = [f"metadata_{col}" for col in metadata.columns]
950            output = pd.concat([output, metadata], axis=1)
951        # Combine with the features and prepend "features_" to the column names
952        if self.features is not None:
953            features = self.features.copy()
954            features.columns = [f"features_{col}" for col in features.columns]
955            output = pd.concat([output, features], axis=1)
956        return output

@classmethod
def from_dataframe( cls, df, metadata_prefix: str = 'metadata_', features_prefix: str = 'features_') -> Self: 
958    @classmethod
959    def from_dataframe(
960        cls, df, metadata_prefix: str = "metadata_", features_prefix: str = "features_"
961    ) -> Self:
962        """
963        From a single, special DataFrame, create an EventArray.
964        :param df: the DataFrame to convert to an EventArray.
965        :param metadata_prefix: the prefix for metadata columns.
966        :param features_prefix: the prefix for features columns.
967        :return: a DataFrame with all the data in the EventArray.
968        """
969        # Split the columns into info, metadata, and features and strip prefix
970        info = df[[col for col in df.columns if col in cls.INFO_COLUMNS]].copy()
971        if info.size == 0:
972            info = None
973        metadata = df[[col for col in df.columns if col.startswith("metadata_")]].copy()
974        metadata.columns = [
975            col.replace(metadata_prefix, "") for col in metadata.columns
976        ]
977        if metadata.size == 0:
978            metadata = None
979        features = df[[col for col in df.columns if col.startswith("features_")]].copy()
980        features.columns = [
981            col.replace(features_prefix, "") for col in features.columns
982        ]
983        if features.size == 0:
984            features = None
985        return cls(info=info, metadata=metadata, features=features)

  • features_prefix: the prefix for features columns.

def from_mask( cls, mask: numpy.ndarray, slide_id: str, tile_n: int, n_roi: int = 0, include_cell_id: bool = True, images: list[numpy.ndarray] = None, image_labels: list[str] = None, properties: list[str] = None) -> Self: 
 987    @classmethod
 988    def from_mask(
 989        cls,
 990        mask: np.ndarray,
 991        slide_id: str,
 992        tile_n: int,
 993        n_roi: int = 0,
 994        include_cell_id: bool = True,
 995        images: list[np.ndarray] = None,
 996        image_labels: list[str] = None,
 997        properties: list[str] = None,
 998    ) -> Self:
 999        """
1000        Extract events from a mask DataFrame, including metadata and features.
1001        :param mask: the mask to extract events from.
1002        :param slide_id: the slide ID the mask is from.
1003        :param tile_n: the tile number the mask is from.
1004        :param n_roi: the ROI number the mask is from.
1005        :param include_cell_id: whether to include the cell_id, or numerical
1006        mask label, as metadata in the EventArray.
1007        :param images: the intensity images to extract features from.
1008        :param image_labels: the labels for the intensity images.
1009        :param properties: list of properties to extract in addition to the defaults:
1010        :return: EventArray corresponding to the mask labels.
1011        """
1012        if csi_images is None:
1013            raise ModuleNotFoundError(
1014                "imageio libraries not installed! "
1015                "run `pip install csi_images[imageio]` to resolve."
1016            )
1017        # Gather mask_info
1018        if images is not None and image_labels is not None:
1019            if len(images) != len(image_labels):
1020                raise ValueError("Intensity images and labels must match lengths.")
1021
1022        mask_info = csi_images.extract_mask_info(mask, images, image_labels, properties)
1023
1024        if len(mask_info) == 0:
1025            return EventArray()
1026
1027        # Combine provided info and mask info
1028        info = pd.DataFrame(
1029            {
1030                "slide_id": slide_id,
1031                "tile": tile_n,
1032                "roi": n_roi,
1033                "x": mask_info["x"],
1034                "y": mask_info["y"],
1035            },
1036        )
1037        # Extract a metadata column if desired
1038        if include_cell_id:
1039            metadata = pd.DataFrame({"cell_id": mask_info["id"]})
1040        else:
1041            metadata = None
1042        # If any additional properties were extracted, add them as features
1043        mask_info = mask_info.drop(columns=["id", "x", "y"], errors="ignore")
1044        if len(mask_info.columns) > 0:
1045            features = mask_info
1046        else:
1047            features = None
1048        return EventArray(info, metadata, features)

Extract events from a mask DataFrame, including metadata and features.

Parameters
  • mask: the mask to extract events from.
  • slide_id: the slide ID the mask is from.
  • tile_n: the tile number the mask is from.
  • n_roi: the ROI number the mask is from.
  • include_cell_id: whether to include the cell_id, or numerical mask label, as metadata in the EventArray.
  • images: the intensity images to extract features from.
  • image_labels: the labels for the intensity images.
  • properties: list of properties to extract in addition to the defaults:
Returns

EventArray corresponding to the mask labels.

def save_hdf5(self, output_path: str) -> bool: 
1079    def save_hdf5(self, output_path: str) -> bool:
1080        """
1081        Save the events to an HDF5 file, including metadata and features.
1082        Uses the pandas-provided HDF5 functions for ease, and external compatibility,
1083        though these files are slightly harder to view in HDFView or similar.
1084        :param output_path:
1085        :return:
1086        """
1087        if not output_path.endswith(".hdf5") and not output_path.endswith(".h5"):
1088            output_path += ".hdf5"
1089        # Open the output_path as an HDF5 file
1090        with pd.HDFStore(output_path) as store:
1091            # Store the dataframes in the HDF5 file
1092            if self.info is not None:
1093                store.put("info", self.info, index=False)
1094            if self.metadata is not None:
1095                store.put("metadata", self.metadata, index=False)
1096            if self.features is not None:
1097                store.put("features", self.features, index=False)
1098        return os.path.exists(output_path)

1105        :return:

def save_ocular(self, output_path: str, event_type: str = 'cells'): 
1115    def save_ocular(self, output_path: str, event_type: str = "cells"):
1116        """
1117        Save the events to an OCULAR file. Relies on the dataframe originating
1118        from an OCULAR file (same columns; duplicate metadata/info).
1119        :param output_path:
1120        :param event_type:
1121        :return:
1122        """
1123        if pyreadr is None:
1124            raise ModuleNotFoundError(
1125                "pyreadr not installed! Install pyreadr directly "
1126                "or run `pip install csi-images[rds]` option to resolve."
1127            )
1128        if event_type == "cells":
1129            file_stub = "rc-final"
1130        elif event_type == "others":
1131            file_stub = "others-final"
1132        else:
1133            raise ValueError("Invalid event type. Must be cells or others.")
1134
1135        # Ensure good metadata
1136        metadata = pd.DataFrame(
1137            {
1138                "slide_id": self.info["slide_id"],
1139                "frame_id": self.info["tile"],
1140                "cell_id": (
1141                    self.metadata["cell_id"]
1142                    if "cell_id" in self.metadata.columns
1143                    else range(len(self.info))
1144                ),
1145                "cellx": self.info["x"],
1146                "celly": self.info["y"],
1147            }
1148        )
1149        if self.metadata is not None:
1150            metadata[self.metadata.columns] = self.metadata.copy()
1151
1152        # Check for the "ocular_interesting" column
1153        if event_type == "cells":
1154            if "ocular_interesting" in metadata.columns:
1155                interesting_rows = metadata["ocular_interesting"].to_numpy(dtype=bool)
1156            elif "hcpc" in metadata.columns:
1157                # Interesting cells don't get an hcpc designation, leaving them as -1
1158                interesting_rows = (
1159                    metadata["hcpc"].to_numpy() == -1
1160                )  # interesting cells
1161            else:
1162                interesting_rows = []
1163            if sum(interesting_rows) > 0:
1164                # Split the metadata into interesting and regular
1165                interesting_events = self.rows(interesting_rows)
1166                interesting_df = pd.concat(
1167                    [interesting_events.features, interesting_events.metadata], axis=1
1168                )
1169                data_events = self.rows(~interesting_rows)
1170                data_df = pd.concat(
1171                    [data_events.features, data_events.metadata], axis=1
1172                )
1173                data_df = data_df.drop(columns=["ocular_interesting"], errors="ignore")
1174
1175                # Drop particular columns for "interesting"
1176                interesting_df = interesting_df.drop(
1177                    [
1178                        "clust",
1179                        "hcpc",
1180                        "frame_id",
1181                        "cell_id",
1182                        "unique_id",
1183                        "ocular_interesting",
1184                    ],
1185                    axis=1,
1186                    errors="ignore",
1187                )
1188                # Save both .csv and .rds
1189                interesting_stub = os.path.join(output_path, "ocular_interesting")
1190                interesting_df.to_csv(f"{interesting_stub}.csv")
1191                # Suppress pandas FutureWarning
1192                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1193                    warnings.simplefilter(action="ignore", category=FutureWarning)
1194                    pyreadr.write_rds(f"{interesting_stub}.rds", interesting_df)
1195            else:
1196                data_df = pd.concat([self.features, metadata], axis=1)
1197        else:
1198            # Get all data and reset_index (will copy it)
1199            data_df = pd.concat([self.features, metadata], axis=1)
1200
1201        # Split based on cluster number to conform to *-final[1-4].rds
1202        n_clusters = max(data_df["clust"]) + 1
1203        split_idx = [round(i * n_clusters / 4) for i in range(5)]
1204        for i in range(4):
1205            subset = (split_idx[i] <= data_df["clust"]) & (
1206                data_df["clust"] < split_idx[i + 1]
1207            )
1208            data_df.loc[subset, "hcpc"] = i + 1
1209            subset = data_df[subset].reset_index(drop=True)
1210            # Suppress pandas FutureWarning
1211            with warnings.catch_warnings():
1212                warnings.simplefilter(action="ignore", category=FutureWarning)
1213                pyreadr.write_rds(
1214                    os.path.join(output_path, f"{file_stub}{i+1}.rds"), subset
1215                )
1216
1217        # Create new example cell strings
1218        data_df["example_cell_id"] = (
1219            data_df["slide_id"]
1220            + " "
1221            + data_df["frame_id"].astype(str)
1222            + " "
1223            + data_df["cell_id"].astype(str)
1224            + " "
1225            + data_df["cellx"].astype(int).astype(str)
1226            + " "
1227            + data_df["celly"].astype(int).astype(str)
1228        )
1229        # Find averagable data columns
1230        if "cellcluster_id" in data_df.columns:
1231            end_idx = data_df.columns.get_loc("cellcluster_id")
1232        else:
1233            end_idx = data_df.columns.get_loc("slide_id")
1234        avg_cols = data_df.columns[:end_idx].tolist()
1235        # Group by cluster and average
1236        data_df = data_df.groupby("clust").agg(
1237            **{col: (col, "mean") for col in avg_cols},
1238            count=("clust", "size"),  # count rows in each cluster
1239            example_cells=("example_cell_id", lambda x: ",".join(x)),
1240            hcpc=("hcpc", lambda x: x.iloc[0]),
1241        )
1242        data_df = data_df.reset_index()  # Do NOT drop, index is "clust"
1243        # Create new columns
1244        metadata = pd.DataFrame(
1245            {
1246                "count": data_df["count"],
1247                "example_cells": data_df["example_cells"],
1248                "clust": data_df["clust"].astype(int),
1249                "hcpc": data_df["hcpc"].astype(int),
1250                "id": data_df["clust"].astype(int).astype(str),
1251                "cccluster": "0",  # Dummy value
1252                "ccdistance": 0.0,  # Dummy value
1253                "rownum": list(range(len(data_df))),
1254                "framegroup": 0,  # Dummy value
1255            }
1256        )
1257        # Need to pad the features to 761 columns, as per OCULAR report needs
1258        additional_columns = range(len(avg_cols), 761)
1259        if len(additional_columns) > 0:
1260            padding = pd.DataFrame(
1261                np.zeros((len(data_df), len(additional_columns))),
1262                columns=[f"pad{i}" for i in additional_columns],
1263            )
1264            data_df = pd.concat([data_df[avg_cols], padding, metadata], axis=1)
1265        else:
1266            data_df = pd.concat([data_df[avg_cols], metadata], axis=1)
1267
1268        # Save the cluster data
1269        data_df.to_csv(os.path.join(output_path, f"{file_stub}.csv"))
1270        # Suppress pandas FutureWarning
1271        with warnings.catch_warnings():
1272            warnings.simplefilter(action="ignore", category=FutureWarning)
1273            pyreadr.write_rds(os.path.join(output_path, f"{file_stub}.rds"), data_df)

Save the events to an OCULAR file. Relies on the dataframe originating from an OCULAR file (same columns; duplicate metadata/info).

Parameters

  • event_type:

@classmethod
def load_ocular( cls, input_path: str, event_type='cells', cell_data_files=('rc-final1.rds', 'rc-final2.rds', 'rc-final3.rds', 'rc-final4.rds', 'ocular_interesting.rds'), others_data_files=('others-final1.rds', 'others-final2.rds', 'others-final3.rds', 'others-final4.rds'), atlas_data_files=('ocular_interesting.rds', 'ocular_not_interesting.rds'), drop_common_events=True, log=None) -> Self: 
1275    @classmethod
1276    def load_ocular(
1277        cls,
1278        input_path: str,
1279        event_type="cells",
1280        cell_data_files=(
1281            "rc-final1.rds",
1282            "rc-final2.rds",
1283            "rc-final3.rds",
1284            "rc-final4.rds",
1285            "ocular_interesting.rds",
1286        ),
1287        others_data_files=(
1288            "others-final1.rds",
1289            "others-final2.rds",
1290            "others-final3.rds",
1291            "others-final4.rds",
1292        ),
1293        atlas_data_files=(
1294            "ocular_interesting.rds",
1295            "ocular_not_interesting.rds",
1296        ),
1297        drop_common_events=True,
1298        log=None,
1299    ) -> Self:
1300        """
1301
1302        :param input_path:
1303        :param event_type:
1304        :param cell_data_files:
1305        :param others_data_files:
1306        :param atlas_data_files:
1307        :param drop_common_events:
1308        :param log:
1309        :return:
1310        """
1311        if pyreadr is None:
1312            raise ModuleNotFoundError(
1313                "pyreadr not installed! Install pyreadr directly "
1314                "or run `pip install csi-images[rds]` option to resolve."
1315            )
1316        # Check if the input path is a directory or a file
1317        if os.path.isfile(input_path):
1318            data_files = [os.path.basename(input_path)]
1319            input_path = os.path.dirname(input_path)
1320        if event_type == "cells":
1321            data_files = cell_data_files
1322        elif event_type == "others":
1323            data_files = others_data_files
1324        else:
1325            raise ValueError("Invalid event type.")
1326
1327        # Load the data from the OCULAR files
1328        file_data = {}
1329        for file in data_files:
1330            file_path = os.path.join(input_path, file)
1331            if not os.path.isfile(file_path):
1332                if log is not None:
1333                    log.warning(f"{file} not found for in {input_path}")
1334                continue
1335            file_data[file] = pyreadr.read_r(file_path)
1336            # Get the DataFrame associated with None (pyreadr dict quirk)
1337            file_data[file] = file_data[file][None]
1338            if len(file_data[file]) == 0:
1339                # File gets dropped from the dict
1340                file_data.pop(file)
1341                if log is not None:
1342                    log.warning(f"{file} has no cells")
1343                continue
1344
1345            if log is not None:
1346                log.debug(f"{file} has {len(file_data[file])} cells")
1347
1348            # Drop common cells if requested and in this file
1349            if (
1350                file in atlas_data_files
1351                and drop_common_events
1352                and "catalogue_classification" in file_data[file]
1353            ):
1354                common_cell_indices = (
1355                    file_data[file]["catalogue_classification"] == "common_cell"
1356                )
1357                if log is not None:
1358                    log.debug(
1359                        f"Dropping {int(pd.Series.sum(common_cell_indices))}"
1360                        f"common cells from {file}"
1361                    )
1362                file_data[file] = file_data[file][common_cell_indices == False]
1363
1364            if len(file_data[file]) == 0:
1365                # File gets dropped from the dict
1366                file_data.pop(file)
1367                if log is not None:
1368                    log.warning(f"{file} has no cells after dropping common cells")
1369                continue
1370
1371            # Extract frame_id and cell_id
1372            # DAPI- events already have frame_id cell_id outside rowname
1373            if event_type == "cells" and "frame_id" not in file_data[file].columns:
1374                file_data[file]["rowname"] = file_data[file]["rowname"].astype("str")
1375                # get frame_id cell_id from rownames column and split into two columns
1376                split_res = file_data[file]["rowname"].str.split(" ", n=1, expand=True)
1377                if len(split_res.columns) != 2:
1378                    log.warning(
1379                        f'Expected "frame_id cell_id" but got {file_data[file]["rowname"]}'
1380                    )
1381                # then assign it back to the dataframe
1382                file_data[file][["frame_id", "cell_id"]] = split_res.astype("int")
1383            # reset indexes since they can cause NaN values in concat
1384            file_data[file] = file_data[file].reset_index(drop=True)
1385
1386        # Merge the data from all files
1387        if len(file_data) == 0:
1388            return EventArray()
1389        elif len(file_data) == 1:
1390            data = [file_data[file] for file in file_data.keys()][0]
1391        else:
1392            data = pd.concat(file_data.values())
1393
1394        if log is not None:
1395            log.debug(f"Gathered a total of {len(data)} events")
1396
1397        # Others is missing the "slide_id". Insert it right before "frame_id" column
1398        if event_type == "others" and "slide_id" not in data.columns:
1399            if os.path.basename(input_path) == "ocular":
1400                slide_id = os.path.basename(os.path.dirname(input_path))
1401            else:
1402                slide_id = "UNKNOWN"
1403            data.insert(data.columns.get_loc("frame_id"), "slide_id", slide_id)
1404
1405        # Sort according to ascending cell_id to keep the original, which is in manual_df
1406        data = data.sort_values(by=["cell_id"], ascending=True)
1407        # Filter out duplicates by x & y
1408        data = data.assign(
1409            unique_id=data["slide_id"]
1410            + "_"
1411            + data["frame_id"].astype(str)
1412            + "_"
1413            + data["cellx"].astype(int).astype(str)
1414            + "_"
1415            + data["celly"].astype(int).astype(str)
1416        )
1417        data = data.drop_duplicates(subset=["unique_id"], keep="first")
1418        # Normal unique_id is with cell_id
1419        data = data.assign(
1420            unique_id=data["slide_id"]
1421            + "_"
1422            + data["frame_id"].astype(str)
1423            + "_"
1424            + data["cell_id"].astype(str)
1425        )
1426        data = data.reset_index(drop=True)
1427        # All columns up to "slide_id" are features; drop the "slide_id"
1428        features = data.loc[:, :"slide_id"].iloc[:, :-1]
1429        data = data.loc[:, "slide_id":]
1430        # Grab the info columns
1431        info = data[["slide_id", "frame_id", "cellx", "celly"]]
1432        info.columns = ["slide_id", "tile", "x", "y"]
1433        info = info.assign(roi=0)  # OCULAR only works on 1 ROI, as far as known
1434        info = info[["slide_id", "tile", "roi", "x", "y"]]
1435        # Metadata has duplicate columns for later convenience
1436        metadata = data
1437        # Certain columns tend to be problematic with mixed data formats...
1438        for col in ["TRITC", "CY5", "FITC"]:
1439            if col in metadata:
1440                labels = {
1441                    "False": False,
1442                    "True": True,
1443                    "FALSE": False,
1444                    "TRUE": True,
1445                }
1446                metadata[col] = metadata[col].map(labels).astype(bool)
1447        for col in ["catalogue_id", "catalogue_distance", "clust", "hcpc"]:
1448            if col in metadata:
1449                metadata[col] = metadata[col].fillna(-1).astype(int)
1450        return EventArray(info, metadata, features)
